travel_tip: This is a relatively short drive, but leaving Nashville after 9:00 AM can help you miss the worst of the morning traffic on I-24.

stops.soc_recommendation: Arrive with ~25% SoC. A 20-minute charge to ~75% will give you plenty of range to get to Atlanta and drive around.

food_stops.name: Sitar Indian Cuisine
food_stops.description: A highly-rated spot offering authentic Indian dishes and a welcoming atmosphere.

food_stops.name: Totto Sushi & Grill
food_stops.description: A family-owned restaurant on the Northshore known for its extensive menu of fresh sushi and hibachi.

rest_areas.name: Marion County Rest Area
rest_areas.location: Mile Marker 160 on I-24 E, Tennessee
rest_areas.description: A convenient and well-maintained stop before you get into the Chattanooga area.

scenic_spots.name: Lookout Mountain
scenic_spots.description: Home to three famous attractions: Rock City Gardens with its breathtaking views, Ruby Falls (America's largest underground waterfall), and the Incline Railway.

scenic_spots.name: Tennessee Riverwalk
scenic_spots.description: A beautiful paved path along the Tennessee River, perfect for a stroll or bike ride to stretch your legs.

kid_friendly_stops.name: Tennessee Aquarium
kid_friendly_stops.description: One of the top-rated aquariums in the country, featuring two buildings for River and Ocean journeys. A fantastic stop for all ages.

kid_friendly_stops.name: Creative Discovery Museum
kid_friendly_stops.description: A leading children's museum with tons of hands-on exhibits focused on art, science, and music.

kid_friendly_stops.name: Rock City Gardens
kid_friendly_stops.description: Kids love exploring the enchanted trail, crossing the swing-a-long bridge, and seeing the views from Lover's Leap.
